channel.title: Best Way To Start A Community?
channel.description: OK, well I want to start a forum, but I don't know how too get people to join... In the past when I would try and get people to join, they would just blow me off and tell me to gtfo... well any advice on how I can start one and get members to join??? BTW, it is a tech forums for computers, programming, video games, and GFX..

item.title: Best Way To Start A Community?
item.dc:creator: @happy_world happy_world
item.description:
@happy_world wrote:

hey i am having a problem with my keyboard need to get a new one if i press m it makes it n. sorry about that i hope my parents will get me a new one soon

item.title: Best Way To Start A Community?
item.dc:creator: @happy_world happy_world
item.description:
@happy_world wrote:

i am not hiring just go to them and ask them a question and they give me the answer. and its all together its for the people to came to gather and its a service. i now a person who made a forum them he changed it and made it for the the community and he gets over 10000 people in his site everyday.

item.source: Best Way To Start A Community?

item.title: Best Way To Start A Community?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

You make it seem as if forums exist to provide help/a service to their users. They do not, the “service” they provide is a place for people to come together. If you are “hiring”/getting teachers from universities to come on your forum and answer questions, you’re essentially running a crappy support service.

Read full topic
item.source: Best Way To Start A Community?

item.title: Best Way To Start A Community?
item.dc:creator: @happy_world happy_world
item.description:
@happy_world wrote:

if you look if i post about something in a new forum i will probably need to wait 2 weeks or even more to get a good response to help me out. for example: i post here on mopar and in at least 24 hours i will start getting good reposes or will guide me to a good direction to my problem.
so to make a good forum you need to make it load fast; not to many big images’ simple and need to get some people who nows example lot about computer, programming, graphics, to help people out.

at the end its all about service even if its free; its about service it offers to it clients.
if i want to open a forum i can do it anytime because i now the wright people that can offer these service to people. i can even get teachers at university to help people out.

you see its all about connections. once i tried to do it for a friend of mine they didn’t help out that much. so later told them i pushed it from him so they helped him out and later his parents too him to a country where there is no internet at all. so it went shutdown after that effort

Read full topic
item.source: Best Way To Start A Community?

item.title: Best Way To Start A Community?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:11, topic:212255”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=279575.msg2275629#msg2275629 date=1213437753]
What does your forum offer that other generic crappy “graphics” and “tech” forums don’t?

If you struggle to think up an answer for this question, this is why nobody is coming to your forum.
If you don’t struggle to think up an answer to this question, let us have it. (Free advertising, go!)
[/quote]
Mopman it could be a forum about poodles not necessarily graphics and tech :P[/quote]

Except that he said it is a “tech forums for computers, programming, video games, and GFX”

Read full topic

item.title: Best Way To Start A Community?
item.dc:creator: @Xion Xion
item.description:
@Xion wrote:

[quote=“Cowie`, post:5, topic:212255”][quote author=Xion link=topic=279575.msg2274936#msg2274936 date=1213413230]

  1. Don’t reinvent the wheel.

didn’t get that sry lol… I don’t know if it was supposed to be funny or not.
[/quote]

Don’t reinvent the wheel means that you shouldn’t try to provide something that already serves it’s purpose. An example would be:

If there is a popular graphics forum and you decide to advertise your smaller one on it, there would be no point, as in most cases the larger one will have what you have and more, but with a bigger member base.[/quote]
Ohhh! lol ok… Didn’t get that at first.

Read full topic
item.source: Best Way To Start A Community?

item.title: Best Way To Start A Community?
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

[quote=“Xion, post:4, topic:212255”][quote author=io9 link=topic=279575.msg2274868#msg2274868 date=1213411501]

  1. Don’t reinvent the wheel.
    [/quote]
    didn’t get that sry lol… I don’t know if it was supposed to be funny or not.[/quote]

Don’t reinvent the wheel means that you shouldn’t try to provide something that already serves it’s purpose. An example would be:

If there is a popular graphics forum and you decide to advertise your smaller one on it, there would be no point, as in most cases the larger one will have what you have and more, but with a bigger member base.

Read full topic
